Reason: The configuration option 'cached_rows_warn_threshold' is performance-sensitive. This is because the 'DatabaseDescriptor.getCachedReplicaRowsWarnThreshold()' method call directly affects the behavior of the 'ReplicaFilteringProtection' class, which is crucial for protecting against inconsistent replica filtering. The value set for 'cached_rows_warn_threshold' determines the threshold at which potentially out-of-date rows are considered, impacting the resolution process and read-repair mechanism. This configuration involves performance-related operations that are memory-expensive and time-expensive within the 'resolveWithReplicaFilteringProtection' method, leading to notable performance variations at the system level.
